description: The SportsJS Soccer schema contains properties common to Curling

curlingEventMetadata.description: An element holding sport-specific metadata about a curling game.

sheet.description: The playing field (ice) for one curling game is called the sheet. In various tournaments the sheets could be identified with numbers, letters or a combination.

draw.description: In curling a game is also called a draw. This is not to be confused with the shot type draw. This attributes can be used to record any curling-specific identification this game/draw has.

curlingPlayerMetadata.description: Holds metadata specific to a curling player.

delivery.description: If the player is playing righthanded or lefthanded.

role.description: If the player has a named role in the team. For example skip or vice skip.

curlingPlayerStats.description: Holds curling-specific stats for certain player.

curlingTeamStats.description: Statistics summarizing the actions of one team.

curlingStatsStone.description: Description of an individual stone used in a curling game.

curlingStatsEnd.description: Statistics for one end (round) for one team in a curling game.

score.description: What was the score for this team this end.

throwOrder.description: What order of play, did this team play the first or last stone this end.

timeUsed.description: How much time was used by this team this end.

curlingStatsAccuracy.description: Holds the summary for shots and percentage for one team or one player and optionally for just one type of shots.

shotType.description: If the stats cover a specific shot-type.

turn.description: If the stats show the values for a specific turn-type inhand or outhand.

percentage.description: The calculated percentage of the shots covered in this stats summary.

numberOfShots.description: Number of shots covered in this stats summary.

stoneIdref.description: A reference to an id of the stone used.

endNumber.description: The number of the end. Rounds of normally 8+8 stones are called ends in curling.
